snippet: The mostly young people of the so-called Umbrella Revolution have found uneven support among middle-age and older people.
abstract: Some Hong Kong residents, weary of disruptions from pro-democracy demonstrators, voice skepticism over their goals and strategies as well as anxiety over emerging divisions in society; major parts of financial capital have been shut down.

byline.contributor: Alan Wong, Keith Bradsher and Austin Ramzy contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The mostly young people of the so-called Umbrella Revolution have found uneven support among middle-age and older people.

headline.main: Some Hong Kong Residents, Weary of Disruptions, Find Fault With Protesters’ Methods
headline.print_headline: Some City Residents, Weary of Disruptions, Find Fault With Protesters’ Methods
